p: miR-30 family is related to the regulation of proliferation processes via Wnt/Î²-catenin [ 91, 92], cell cycle control [ 93], apoptosis [ 94, 95] and senescence in various cell models [ 96, 97]. In melanoma, it is related to increased cell invasion due to increased aberrant glycosylations associated with its molecular target GALNT7 [ 98].
